ClassNotFoundException(java.lang.String).Description: Constructs a ClassNotFoundException with the specified detail message.

Parameters: Throwable: the exception that was raised while loading the class
ClassNotFoundException(java.lang.String,.Description: Constructs a ClassNotFoundException with the specified detail message and optional exception that was raised while loading the class.

ClassNotFoundException().Description: Constructs a ClassNotFoundException with no detail message.

Returns: the Exception that was raised while loading a class
getException().Description: Returns the exception that was raised if an error occurred while attempting to load the class. Otherwise, returns This method predates the general-purpose exception chaining facility. The @B_java#lang#Throwable#getCause_E@ method is now the preferred means of obtaining this information.

getCause().Description: Returns the cause of this exception (the exception that was raised if an error occurred while attempting to load the class; otherwise

ClassDesc: Thrown when an application tries to load in a class through its string name using: The forName method in class Class. The findSystemClass method in class ClassLoader . The loadClass method in class ClassLoader. but no definition for the class with the specified name could be found. As of release 1.4, this exception has been retrofitted to conform to the general purpose exception-chaining mechanism. The "optional exception that was raised while loading the class" that may be provided at construction time and accessed via the @B_java#lang#ClassNotFoundException#getException_E@ method is now known as the @B_java#lang#Throwable#getCause_E@ method, as well as the aforementioned "legacy method."
